intro: Achillea carinata, commonly known as narrow-leaved yarrow, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright, branched stems and finely divided, feathery leaves. Its flowers are small and clustered in flat-topped umbels, ranging in color from white to pale yellow. Achillea carinata is often found in dry, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils.
